title: Star Wars 7's Harrison Ford at the Golden Globes 2016 with wife Calista Flockhart
title_page: Star Wars 7's Harrison Ford at the Golden Globes 2016 with wife Calista Flockhart | Daily Mail Online
text:
Most people at the age of 73 look forward to spending their Sunday evenings relaxing at home with their feet up.
So no wonder Harrison Ford was grinning with glee as he showed off his much younger wife Calista Flockhart at the Golden Globes on Sunday.
The handsome actor was grinning like a Cheshire cat as he graced the red carpet with the Ally McBeal favourite.
Scroll down for video
Not going Solo: Star Wars legend Harrison Ford showed off his much younger wife Calista Flockhart at the Golden Globes on Sunday
The Star Wars legend looked as cool as they come in a classic tuxedo, bow tie and wonderfully shiny leather shoes.
But it was the father-of-five's 51-year-old's other half who was really turning heads in a snazzy dark turquoise dress, which boasted ornate embroidery at the bust.
Calista looked delighted to be back at the venue where their love affair began away back in 2002, when she was still a star in her own right as the leading lady of smash hit show Ally McBeal.
See the latest updates on Star Wars: The Force Awakens star Harrison Ford
No wonder he's smiling: Harrison will be the envy of his peers after marrying a woman 22 years his junior
Ford focus: He showed laser beam-like awareness of the cameras as he posed up on the red carpet
A Force to be reckoned with: Harrison is still going strong in both his professional and personal lives
Ally McStealing his heart: Calista and Harrison first hooked up at the awards show in 2002 and got married just over eight years later
She is now featuring as Cat Grant in the new CBS superhero show Supergirl, who in the show is the shallow and superficial founder of the CatCo Worldwide Media.
While her career is ticking over nicely, Harrison's has just blasted into hyperspace after he reprised his career launching role of Han Solo in what could be the biggest box office hit of all time, Star Wars: The Force Awakens.
Ally McStealing the show: His other half left her husband in the shade after donning this elegant dress
The Fugitive makes his getaway: Eventually the actor tired of posing up and headed indoors to find his seat
Come here young lady: Harrison was looking full of beans at the HBO party after the event
The Disney film, which premiered in China on Saturday, brought in an estimated $53 million in China this weekend according to studio.
In North America it raked in another $41.6 million this weekend, and has topped the charts for the fourth weekend in a row.
It has now made an estimated $812 million in the US, and is the only picture in history to make more than $800 million domestically.
Ford fiesta: The pair looked like they were having a great time together at the posh Beverly Hilton Hotel
Just like old times: The pair looked like they were reliving their first romantic meeting in 2002
His Last Crusade: It is unlikely the Indiana Jones star and his wife would have been partying all night
A Star is born: His turn as Han Solo in A New Hope saw him become a leading man overnight
End of an era? Harrison finally reprised his role for what may be the final time in The Force Awakens
